moves.1. e4: This was our second meeting on the board.  I accepted the challenge he issued immediately on the conclusion of our first encounter.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Qf6: I was certainly aware by now of his tendency to attack hard and fast.
moves.4. O-O d6: Opening a line for his Queen's Bishop to join the attack.
moves.5. Nc3 Qg6: Made with an eye on Bh3 perhaps?
moves.6. d3: Submitting to the pin but making Bh3 questionable perhaps?
moves.6... Bg4 7. Re1 Nd4 8. Kh1: Foregoing pawn structure to lend additional support to the f3 square.
moves.8... Ne6 9. Re3: Most likely there are better alternatives available.  (Did I learn anything from our previous confrontation?)
moves.9... Ng5 10. Qf1 Nf6: Hmmm, a chance to untangle my position!
moves.11. Nxg5 Qxg5 12. Rg3 Qh4 13. Nd5 O-O-O: One could only hope he would mistakenly retake with his Queen.
moves.15. Bxf7 Rd7 16. Bb3: If my Bishop had not been en prise I might have given h3 a shot at this point.
moves.16... Rg7: He is ganging up on my King, and I don't recall it ever doing anything to him.
moves.17. Be3: This was more for defensive than offensive purposes.
moves.17... Rhg8: I cannot believe my luck!!!!!  He is so focused on my King's position he forgot about my Bishop at b3.
moves.18. Bxg8: Not to hesitate in this situation.  (In other words this was just a mistake and not part of any greater trap.)
moves.18... Rxg8 19. f3: Now, let us look at his g4 Bishop's status.
moves.19... h5 20. fxg4 hxg4 21. Qf5+: I was hoping the Black Rook undefended by a pawn would be on g4 when I made this move; but you work with whatever is there.  The check gives Black an opportunity to go wrong.
moves.21... Kb8: And he immediately takes it.  Perhaps it was the Bishop aiming at a7; whatever the reason, Kb8 will cost Black nothing less than a Rook.
moves.22. Qe6: Black can alleviate the mating threat but cannot simultaneously protect his Rook.
moves.22... Rh8: He misses my mating threat, saves his Rook and threatens his own mate.
moves.23. Qe8#: Maybe he was hoping I did not know what I had and would play Kg1.  Better to have given up the Rook with say b7 or c5 although an ultimate loss would still have been likely.
